channel.title: Help

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

[quote=“frozon566, post:2, topic:440940”]ints are variables, its like in math class, ints just hold a value, ints are 1 of a lot of variable types, there really is no “accessing” them, however if you download an IDE it would help you to see them better since it color codes…well your code.

About “c” usually servers use “c” to mean “client” aka the players and its usually defined before hand, if it isn’t your compiler throws out the error your currently having, you are trying to say

“c.freak”

and the compiler doesn’t see where you have declared this “c” variable, it doesn’t know what the hell your talking about. So to fix you need to actually delcare “c”, also when you compile, post the actual error itself.[/quote]

src\server\model\npcs\NPCHandler.java:1982: cannot find symbol
symbol  : variable c
location: class server.model.npcs.NPCHandler
                                                            if (npcs[i].npcType
== 3838 && c.freak <6){

           ^
src\server\model\npcs\NPCHandler.java:1991: cannot find symbol
symbol  : variable c
location: class server.model.npcs.NPCHandler

if(c.freak == 6) {

   ^
Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
2 errors
Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @frozon566 frozon566
item.description:
@frozon566 wrote:

ints are variables, its like in math class, ints just hold a value, ints are 1 of a lot of variable types, there really is no “accessing” them, however if you download an IDE it would help you to see them better since it color codes…well your code.

About “c” usually servers use “c” to mean “client” aka the players and its usually defined before hand, if it isn’t your compiler throws out the error your currently having, you are trying to say

“c.freak”

and the compiler doesn’t see where you have declared this “c” variable, it doesn’t know what the hell your talking about. So to fix you need to actually delcare “c”, also when you compile, post the actual error itself.

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

How do I acess int’s in player.java
from Npchandler

This is what im trying to do…

if (npcs[i].npcType == 3838 && c.freak < 6){
										if (Misc.random(10) <=1) {
										
										npcs[i].updateRequired = true;
							npcs[i].forceAnim(2048);
								npcs[i].forceChat("Help!");
          
                                        }
								 }else
								 if (c.freak == 6)
								 {
                               }

And it’s saying it can’t find the symbol c. of server.model.npchandler;

Read full topic
